noun.description: An event with a powerful and unpleasant effect; a blow.
examples: the third whammy was the degradation of the financial system

origin: 1940s: from the noun wham + -y; associated from the 1950s with the cartoon strip Li'l Abner, in which the hillbilly Evil-Eye Fleegle could shoot a whammy (to put a curse on somebody) by pointing a finger with one eye open, and a double whammy with both eyes open.
